intro: Huperzia hystrix, commonly known as the spurred huperzia, is a species of fern-like plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spore-bearing cones and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant typically grows in temperate regions, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually simple and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its unique appearance. Huperzia hystrix plays a role in nutrient cycling and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
